Again this error still remain if I change back the parameter from datasource to byte[]. It remains until I exit eclipse and reboot the computer!

I tried to enable the traces with the .options file and the -debug option, but nothing appears in the command window except that the .options has been loaded.

Is it possible, with the WebService wizard, to create a web service with a large binary attachment, not a base64 field as generated with a byte[] parameter?

Michel, sorry you're having grief with DataSource.

Early in comment 1 you wrote about getting a NoClassDefFoundError for javax/wsdl/DataSource. There is no such class, so I assume you meant to write javax/activation/DataSource. Our issues with DataSource stem from excluding activation.jar from Eclipse WTP due to concerns the Eclipse legal team has with the licensing of the Java Activation Framework (JAF). Once activation.jar finds its way onto the project build path, bug AXIS-2146 [1] in the Axis emitters pops up and produces the NoClassDefFoundError. Clearing this condition requires at least shutting down and re-launching Eclipse since Axis keeps a static cache of jars from the build path. A reboot should not be required.

When you applied the technique in bug 104993 comment 8, please double check that you didn't accidentally remove entries or forget a comma in manifest.mf. I can't think of how javax/wsdl/extensions/ExtensibilityElement could not be found unless wsdl4j-1.5.1.jar had effectively disappeared from the manifest.

To your last question, you can use MIME attachments or base64Binary XML. The latter always maps to byte[]. With a few specific exceptions, attachments map to javax.activation.DataHandler (not DataSource). Out of the box, WTP blocks the use of JAF classes for the legal reasons touched on above. Provided you apply the technique in bug 104993 comment 8, you should be able to use WTP to generate Web services with MIME attachments.

[1] http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AXIS-2146

Thanks Kathy for your explanations. I just try to use DataHandler and I was able to send a binary attachment!
In any case, it could be useful to have some article explaining how to use attachment using the wizard.
Bug 105611 has been opened for documentating attachment support in WTP Web services tool.

As we are trying to close down WTP 1.5, please get the latest WTP 1.5 driver to verify the bug and reopen if the problem had not been fixed.  If this defect is not verified/reopened by end of day 06/16, I'll attempt to verify the defect by reproducing the problem as described in the defect.  However, since you know your scenario best, it would be more appropriate if you verify the fix.
